channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Cuomo relaunches NYC mayoral campaign as independent after primary loss to Mamdani
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's Democratic primary win for NYC mayor last month over Andrew Cuomo was regarded as a major upset. But Cuomo says he's not out of the race yet.

item.title: Action must follow Trump's 'remarkable shift' on Russia, says Sen. Richard Blumenthal
item.description: A bipartisan bill in Congress would enable President Trump to slap "bone-crushing sanctions" on Russia, says Democratic Sen. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut.

item.title: President Trump announces major shift in policy toward Russia
item.description: President Trump says his conversations with Russia's Putin have led him to doubt Putin's interest in a ceasefire. Now, Trump has threatened harsh measures if Russia doesn't make a peace deal.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump announces major shift in policy toward Russia, Supreme Court says Trump's efforts to close the Education Department can continue, Trump faces backlash over handling of Epstein files.

item.title: DC's James Gunn discusses the superhero movie business
item.description: "Superman" writer and director James Gunn is also the co-CEO of DC Studios. He explains what happened after a superhero movie gold rush ended.

item.title: Thousands continue search for those missing following deadly floods in central Texas
item.description: Recent storms have slowed recovery efforts in central Texas following the July 4 floods that killed more than 130 people. About 14,000 volunteers are searching for at least 100 people still missing.

item.title: President Trump faces backlash over handling of Jeffrey Epstein files
item.description: President Trump is facing backlash for how his administration has handled the promised release of evidence surrounding the life and death of disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Trump's tariffs are prompting many in Japan to rethink relationship with the U.S.
item.description: With elections coming in Japan, the threat of U.S. tariffs is forcing its prime minister to start talking tougher, and is getting people to rethink long-held assumptions about relations with the U.S.

item.title: Wildfire destroys historic Grand Canyon Lodge
item.description: Arizona's governor is demanding answers about how the National Park Service handled a wildfire burning out of control in Grand Canyon National Park. The fire destroyed a historic lodge there.
